en-gb: An elderly woman has had her purse stolen from her house through an open window
A witness can offer a vague description but no direction of travel
A student has had his mobile phone stolen from his hall table in his house whilst he was upstairs
Further more detailed description and photograph is provided giving a direction of travel of the criminal
A citizen has seen the elderly thief acting suspiciously outside a house in the area where the front door appears open. Photograph uploaded

Thanks to the stored data in the INSPEC2T system, the coordinator sends via INSPEC2T app images of the suspect to the CPO. The witness recognises it to be the elderly man seen committing the first theft and the images is sent to the patrols in the area who have now arrested the individual
The police retrace the criminal's steps via the citizen sightings on INSPEC2T and locate the stolen items hidden on the way
A mother has added a post claiming her 5-year-old daughter has gone missing from her front garden. She has uploaded a recent photograph. The weather is cold and it is getting dark
Two sightings have been made by citizens who claim to have seen a girl with an unknown male heading towards the river area.
Uploaded photographs have proved that a child with an unknown male is not the missing child
An INSPEC2T member posts having seen a child fitting the description on the other sider of the area playing with other children
One INSPEC2T user approaches the children to bring the missing girl home but is challenged by local adults about approaching children
Police officers arrive and using the details provided on INSPEC2T identify the missing child and take her home
Police return the child to her mother and the benefits of the INSPEC2T platform are realised and appreciated. Community confidence in the police is improved greatly

Waiting at this stage is fine, but there is no real benefit to waiting until another crime is committed

Given this is an elderly person and the fact that they may be badly shaken it may be good to have police there, this could act as a deterent. But consider the crime has happened and is not life threatening.
It us good to raise awareness to citizens for possible sightings and further crimes or description to aid police
Asking citizens for more sightings can raise awareness against further crimes
There is now a second theft and the possibility of further thefts is possible, sending officers should help prevent further crimes
Asking citizens about sighting to raise awareness can help prevent further crimes and gain more details
Waiting here will not help solve the crime
Great! Sending an officer is the right thing to do, provided a better desciption and direction of travel, a successful arrest is a strong possibility
Action needs to be taken as there is a potential crime about to take place
Great! Sending an officer is the right thing to do, provided a better desciption and direction of travel, a successful arrest is a strong possibility
Waiting at this stage will allow time to gain more information and prioritise a response to the situation
It could be too early to send an officer without further information
Engaging with the community to gain as much information as possible is very important
Waiting could potentially put a child's life at risk, and should not be considered
Sending an officer is an absolute must given the risk to a young child
Waiting can potentially put a child's life at risk, and is not an option to be considered. You should have asked for help from citizens
Encouraging community participation is exceptionally important at this point as they can provide much more insight and information of the area covered by the INSPEC2T app
Waiting at this stage would put a child's life at risk and is not an option to be considered
Sending an officer is an absolute must given the risk to a young child
Waiting could potentially cause a disagreement between members of the community
Sending officers will help to resolve the missing girl issue but will also improve relations with community members
